Articles.Content:
So today i watched this vid

and i got an idea for a challenge. So he reached 6,8% Light speed, which made me think "Hmmm in KSP everything is possible" and after that i decided to make a challenge. The goal is to reach the speed of light (which is 300,000 km/s or 299,792,458 m/s) with a rocket.

The rules are:

1) Only allowed parts are from NovaPunch remix pack and default parts

2) No hacked fuel or modified engines to deliver megatons of thrust

3) No using cheat engine to speed up the game or to do weird hacks

4) Only 3 rules

If you've achieved such god powers take a screenshot or two and maybe a video and post it on the forums!

Good luck and god speed all!

Fly safe.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/16520-Reach-the-Speed-of-Light%21-%28Read-desc%29

It's on the first page on this forum. Read before you post. Btw it's nigh impossible even with modified parts.
For me it doesn't show on any pages on the challenge sectioin O_O
You'd have to do it in the demo version The star Kerbol has a surface in the paid version of KSP. Velocities of 200 km/s are probably only barely in the realm of the possible now.

More than 1500000 m/s delta V.

Burning on on the ground because i do not want to wait five days.
